CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1964, pg. 3, reads: "MAGISTRATE APPOINTMENT - The above picture was taken in January 1946, shortly after Mr. Williams and his wife Alberta received the happy news that Mr. Williams was to become the first Negro police magistrate. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Robert E. "Pappy" Williams, and his wife Alberta Williams, seated on sofa with Pittsburgh Courier newspaper with headlines reading "Russia Inspired U.S. Youth Leader" and "Better Teamwork Between White and Negro Leaders Urged"
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Living rooms--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Living room furniture--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Williams, Robert E.Williams, Alberta.
